sentences.en: Ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts as exponents, logarithms, quadratic equations, and permutations.
sentences.cn: 在工作中能运用高等数学概念,如指数, 对数, 二次方程式和排列.

sentences.en: Ability to apply advanced mathematical concepts such as exponents, logarithms, quadratic equations, and permutations.
sentences.cn: 能够运用高等数学的概念,如指数, 对数, 二次方程, 和排列.

sentences.en: At the last count Audi offered 674 model permutations across its range.
sentences.cn: 最后我们来看看奥迪,他们总共制造674种不同的车型.

sentences.en: Calculate numbers of possible outcomes of elementary combinatorial processes such as permutations and combinations.
sentences.cn: 计算出基本组合程序(例如排列与组合)的可能产生数目.

sentences.en: Godliman's brain was in gear again, sorting permutations and possibilities.
sentences.cn: 戈德利曼又开动思想的机器, 认真分析各种变化和可能.

sentences.en: Khalid Boulahrouz's imminent return from a dislocated shoulder come to increase permutations the back this weekend.
sentences.cn: 卡里德.博拉鲁斯即将从肩膀脱臼归来,但仍旧赶不及为这周末于后防增添变数.

sentences.en: More than a dozen variable factors could interact, with their permutations running into the thousands ( Tom Clancy )
sentences.cn: 一打以上的可变因素可以相互作用, 使它们的排列成成千上万 ( 汤姆克兰西 )

sentences.en: Random molecular permutations simply cannot explain how organisms work.
sentences.cn: 仅凭分析随机分子排列的规律不可能解释器官的形成.

sentences.en: The permutations make shopping a puzzle rather than a pleasure.
sentences.cn: 这样挑来挑去,买东西真叫人犯难而毫无乐趣.

sentences.en: The possible permutations of those connections are more than there are particles in the universe.
sentences.cn: 这些连接的可能排列数比宇宙中的粒子数还要多.

sentences.en: The possible permutations of x, y and z are xyz, xzy, yxz, yzx, zxy and zyx.
sentences.cn: x、y和z的可能的组合方式为xyz、xzy、yxz、yzx、zxy和zyx。

sentences.en: The variations and permutations were endless.
sentences.cn: 真是众说纷纭,没完没了.

sentences.en: There are a number of permutations depending on the reference type.
sentences.cn: 依据不同的参考献型式有不同的排列.
这些排列可以增加到无穷大。

sentences.en: Variation among humans is limited to the possible permutations of our genes.
sentences.cn: 人类的变异受限于我们的基因可能存在哪些排列。

trans.tran_cn: （一组事物可能的一种）序列，排列，排列中的任一组数字或文字( permutation的名词复数 )
trans.tran_en: A permutation is one of the ways in which a number of things can be ordered or arranged
